subject: Cybersecurity
title: Operation Sundevil: The FBI Strikes Back
description: A micro-lesson that makes Operation Sundevil: The FBI Strikes Back usable.

hook.text: In 1990, the FBI raided homes across 14 cities in the largest crackdown on hackers in history.

buildup.text: Operation Sundevil targeted BBS operators and credit card fraud. Agents seized 42 computers and 23,000 disks.

discovery.text: The raids were heavy-handed. Many targets were hobbyists, not criminals. The charges often didn't stick.

twist.text: The backlash created the Electronic Frontier Foundation, which still defends digital rights today.

climax.text: Government overreach in fighting hackers accidentally birthed the digital civil liberties movement.

punchline.text: The FBI's crackdown created its own opposition.

quiz.question: What organization was founded in response to Operation Sundevil?
